description: Complete MCP Server Configuration for vehicle-in-need project

github.description: GitHub MCP server for interacting with GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, and workflows. Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated.

setup.install: Visit https://cli.github.com/ to install gh CLI
setup.authenticate: Run 'gh auth login' to authenticate with GitHub

playwright.description: Playwright MCP server for browser automation and testing. Provides capabilities for navigating web pages, taking screenshots, interacting with elements, and capturing console/network activity.

setup.install: Installed automatically via npx when server starts
setup.browsers: Browsers are installed automatically on first use

firebase-v5.description: Custom Firebase MCP server for interacting with Firebase services including Firestore, Authentication, and Admin SDK operations. Uses service account for authentication.

setup.service_account: Place service account JSON file at path specified in FIREBASE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FILE
setup.project: Ensure FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID matches your Firebase project

security.note: Service account credentials provide admin access - keep secure
security.recommended: Use least-privilege service accounts in production

usage.location: This configuration should be placed in the Copilot coding agent settings under the MCP servers section
notes: Each MCP server provides specialized tools and capabilities
Servers are invoked automatically by the coding agent when relevant tasks are detected
Environment variables must be configured before server startup
Service account files and credentials must be properly secured

common_issues: GitHub CLI not installed - install from https://cli.github.com/
Browsers not installed - Playwright will auto-install on first use
Headless mode issues - check display configuration in codespaces/WSL
Permission errors - ensure user has access to browser binaries
Service account file not found - verify path in FIREBASE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FILE
Invalid credentials - regenerate service account key from Firebase Console
Project ID mismatch - ensure FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID matches your project
Permission denied - verify service account has required IAM roles

development.notes: All servers enabled for full development capabilities

ci_cd.notes: Only GitHub server needed in CI/CD environments

production.notes: MCP servers are development tools and should not be used in production deployments
